snippet: Federal regulators found that Ameridose, a drug producer linked to a national meningitis outbreak, had not provided enough assurance that all the medicines it made were sterile.
abstract: Ameridose, drug producer linked to New England pharmacy at center of national meningitis outbreak, announces recall of all of its products after federal regulators found that it had not provided enough assurance that all medicines it made were sterile.
lead_paragraph: Federal regulators found that Ameridose, a drug producer linked to a national meningitis outbreak, had not provided enough assurance that all the medicines it made were sterile.

headline.seo: Ameridose Announces Recall Amid Questions About Drugs’ Sterility
headline.main: Amid Purity Questions, Drug Company Recalls Products
headline.print_headline: Amid Purity Questions, Drug Company Recalls Products
